intro: Capsella rubelliformis, commonly known as the red-stemmed catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Capsella rubelliformis is an annual plant that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
